column4: Hi! I started recording a video from my webcam with mencoder. I accidentaly turned it off with ctrl-z instead of ctrl-c. This resulted in mencoder not "unloading?" the webcam. So the webcam is now stuck and mencoder says that its busy.
I tried to rmmod the driver. But it reported that it was in use.
Is there a way to undo this without a reboot?
Is there a way to put programs in the background wihtout suspending them?
if u typed ctl-z, you can type "bg %#" (# as for the number from the jobs list)
I actually looked in top to see if mencoder was stuck in something. But I guess I didn't look hard enough :P
i believe u can type "bg <command>" as well...
no.. "help" is a bash-only builtin for referencing its builtins
/usr/share/doc/packagename is also locations where there can be examples for example -- (mencoder package is it?-- /usr/share/doc/mencoder)
